Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 21:10. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near Deaks Lane.

A customer has asked UK Power Networks to switch off the power so they can safely cut back
trees in the area that have grown close to overhead electricity cables. These trees could cause
damage to the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so a tree surgeon can safely cut the trees
away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the
future as we appreciate that some customers have experienced 2 unplanned power cuts in the
last 6 months.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are needing to replace a piece of our electrical equipment due to it coming to the end of its serviceable life. This equipment is known as a linkbox and is essential equipment where our cables connect underground. To ensure our engineers can carry out these works safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Once work is completed this will ensure our electricity network is working to the best of its ability and also reduce the possibility of having an unplanned power cut. This work is taking place in the Broadway area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Cherry Tree Road.

months.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near Kelchers Lane.

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our
equipment in your area. This has identified 3 sections of cables and 4 electricity poles that need
replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in
the future as we appreciate that some customers have been affected by multiple unplanned power
cuts in the last 6 months.
To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure
the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation
works prior to the power cut.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place on Church Road.

A customer has asked UK Power Networks to switch off the power so they can safely cut back
trees in the area that have grown close to overhead electricity cables. These trees could cause
damage to the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so a tree surgeon can safely cut the trees
away from 2 sections of cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power
cut in the future.

We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Holt Road.

This work is taking place on Thorney Way.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 01:59 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Southernhay area should be back on. The issue was caused by an underground network fault, which our engineers have repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 01:02 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that they have restored power to two more properties, and repairs are ongoing, however they've advised a new time of 01:30-02:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 04:06 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around a fault on the underground network in the Bathurst Gardens area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 03:00
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Bathurst Gardens area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Decasta at 21:05 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair an underground cabling fault in the Hillside Drive area.

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Decasta at 20:02 - As it's approaching that time of night where most of our customers are going to sleep, we wanted to let you know that we will continue to send text messages throughout the night with progress updates.

If you want to continue receiving updates but prefer not to be disturbed, you can place your phone on silent or activate the Do Not Disturb settings on smart phones.

If you no longer want to receive updates, you will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you

Hi, it's Decasta from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 19:18 - We can now confirm that all power in the Wagner Street  area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 18:52 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Wagner Street area, the estimated time of 21:00 and 22:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Roland at 18:05.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Stuart at 20:11 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 144 customers in the Foxearth CO10 7 area to safely repair an overhead cable on the ground.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 20:02 - Our engineers have advised us that in order to continue their works on the overhead cable on the ground safely, they have had to turn off power to further properties in the area. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Sent by Theo at 00:40 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 74 customers in the Buchan Hill area, by repairing an overhead network fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.

Steps.Message: Sent by Theo at 00:18 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 16:43. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 01:50 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 162 customers in the Carr Avenue area, by diverting power around an overhead network fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, so we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Theo at 01:22 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 23:46 - Thanks for your patience this evening.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.
